column4: hi, i compiled my own kernel(build my drivers and other required module into kernel), i tried 3 difrent .configure (in some i do not disable any modules) Problem is that i do not have sound or network driver
i need help to diagnostic my problem
anyone compiled  a custom kernel here?

hi, i compiled my own kernel(build my drivers and other required module into kernel), i tried 3 difrent .configure (in some i do not disable any modules) Problem is that i do not have sound or network driver
did you do make oldconfig?
yes, i do that one time, other time configured manualy the .config because the menu config  saved a file with fewer lines
which kernel are you compiling?  (and as long as I'm asking, why are you compiling a kernel?)
can you tell me what logs should i look in , what coomands to do to find out what could be the problem
the 2.6.24 from hard repos
i compile a kernel to build my driver in to increase the performance
where did you get the idea that compiling your own kernel would increase performance?
i.e., are you adding any patches?
i do not add patches just my drivers like scsi acpi  VFAT, FUSE i build them into the kernel,
maybe i should seitch to gentoo
there's no practical difference between the performance of using modules vs the performance of compiling them straight in,
except that when you compile them in, you're forced to use that memory, which may be a waste in many many cases
but at boot speed? that modules are loaded at boot speed, and it must be some slight performance if i optimize the kernel for my intel pentium cpu
not really, no
the generic kernel already has pentium optimizations in
from the .config of the generic kernel it is not optimized for pentium
ubuntu's -generic kernel is, yes
